intro: Achnodonton bellardii, commonly known as the bellard's flaxflower, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and produces small, yellowish to brownish flowers. It has linear, grass-like leaves and is often found in desert or semi-desert environments. Achnodonton bellardii is adapted to arid conditions and is considered a perennial herb.
